• Mechanical and Electrical aptitude is a plus and must have potential to be developed by candidateAbility to work on a professional team with a willingness to learn and grow with the company.
• Prepare and submit reports as required to keep management updated on project status.
• Maintain and continually improve technical and professional abilities described above and required to perform assigned tasks.
• Proficiency in Office 365 Typically requires a bachelor's degree in engineering and five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience.
• Experience developing software applications or machine vision systems.
• Design, build and support software applications (C, C++, C#,.
• Design, build and support software library interfaces to common vision tools.
• Define sensors, lighting and optics for solving machine vision problems.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field2+ years of experience in embedded software development with a focus on motor control, especially FOCProficiency in embedded software development using C and C++Strong understanding of electrical motors, control theory, and their correct applicationExperience with communication protocols like EtherCAT, CAN, SPI, I2C or others Architecture and firmware development for NEO's motors.
• Develop software for specific motor control requirements and applications.
• Understanding of electromagnetic design and robotic actuation principlesExperience in sensors (position, current, temperature,.
• ) and their implementation into a systemStrong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex software and hardware issuesExperience in PCB design You can shape the future of humanoid robotsYou will have the autonomy to improve all aspects of your technical skillsYou’ll join an agile and diverse, global team Lead the development of significant motor control software components.
• Implement real-time control algorithms, safety mechanisms, and communication protocols (e.
• , CAN, LIN, SPI, I2C).
• Support the rest of the actuators team on evaluation and testing.
• Drive features in the higher level robot software safety layer.

• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
